Reviews.Title: Sometimes...Not BEING a Smart TV... is The SMART TV!
Reviews.Author: F. Maria
Reviews.Content: UPDATE:The picture settings that I previouly stated in my review were made while the `Eco Solutions' settings (found under the `Plug & Play' tab) is set to `On'.However, I found something very interesting.  If you change `Eco Solution' setting' to' Off', it dramatically changed the picture.  When you first turn the setting to `Off', the picture turns exceptionally bright.  However, it is not as bad as you think.  While having the `Eco Solution' setting set to `Off', I made the following changes to my settings and I'm updating my review to allow for a choice between the two options.  No matter which setting changes you choose, your picture will be greatly improved.  It's just a matter of taste.Again, my goal all along was to get the clearest, most stunning picture that the set had to offer without comprising the beautiful blacks, nor the brilliant colors, nor the outstanding 3D like effects you can sometimes perceive, all while never having to change the settings between channels or sources, no matter what the lighting of the room may be. I believe that I succeeded in this endeavor.If you choose to set the `Eco Solutions' setting found under the `Plug & Play Tab' to `Off', then try these settings.  I recommend that you do a `Picture Reset' first.  This is found under the `Picture' settings.Under The `TV Picture' settings, I have the `Picture Mode' set to `Standard', the `Backlight' set to `10', `Contrast' set to `80', Brightness set to `45', `Sharpness' set to `50', color set to `50', and tint (G/R) set to `50/50.  Under the `Advance Tab' settings, I set the `Color Space' to `Native', the `Dynamic Contrast' to `Low', the `Black Tone' to 'Dark', (and here is a big change), the `Flesh Tone' to -3, and the `Motion Lighting' to `Off'.  Under the `Picture Options Tab' settings, I set `Color Tone' to `Standard', the `Digital Noise filter' to `Auto', the `HDMI Black Level' to `Low', The `Film Mode' to `Auto', The `Auto Motion Plus' to `Clear' and the `LED Motion Plus' to `Off'.If you choose to set the `Eco Solutions' setting found under the `Plug & Play Tab' to `On', then try these settings.  Once again, I recommend that you do a `Picture Reset' first.  This is found under the `Picture' settings.Using the `Standard' viewing mode settings for everything, I made the following changes. Under `Picture' settings, I changed the contrast from `100' to `85'. Under `Advanced Settings', I set the `color space' to `native' the Dynamic Contrast to `medium' the Black Tone to' Dark' and turned the motion lighting `Off". Under `Picture Options', I have the color tone at' standard', digital noise filter at `auto', HDMI Black level at `Low', Film Mode at `Auto', Auto Motion Plus at `Clear', and turned the LED Motion Plus to `Off'.ORIGINAL REVIEW:First I must say that I didn't purchase this TV from Amazon. However, I love Amazon and I love this TV!PROS:This TV is aesthetically gorgeous and made a solid hand shake with my receiver.  It has surprisingly smooth sounding speakers that I can finally hear over my loud AC.  The colors are vibrant, vivid, actual, and true.  The picture can, at times, appear to look like a 3D TV when viewing certain movie sources.  It quickly powers on and off and plays a sweet sound.  It comes with a perfectly sized backlit remote that has a sleep button on it.  It does not use Edge lit or ARC channel technology.  Yea!CONS:I had a dickens of a time tweaking this set.  Initially, it gave off a bright, 'reality' type look. My circle of people thought that this was a cool thing. However, I hated it with a passion and spent the last two weeks trying to get rid of it.These changes made all the difference in the world and now there is uniformity between all of the source material.  Movies, be it cable broadcast movies or Blu Ray movies , as well as primetime cable shows including cable news, all look the way they were intended.SUMMATION:In my quest to find the best TV for the money, I've discovered that most of today's LED TV's are challenged with the aforementioned "soap opera' effect.  In a way, it's understandable.  Networks broadcast their shows using a multitude of lighting choices.  That alone can be problematic.  Add to that the commercials that are broadcast in a non-HD format and then throw in the desire for TV makers to make TV panels super thin and you get too many options for your backlight to choose from.  All I know for sure is that I love the fact that, with this TV, Samsung chose to put the backlights across the whole of the back of the TV and not around the edges.  Also, please know that, in my opinion, this TV is easily thin enough, takes up surprisingly little space and has the audacity to look beautiful.I actually HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS TV and think that it is a fantastic TV and it is being offered at a fantastic price. YOU JUST GOT TO TWEAK IT. I'm also writing it so that the next person doesn't become discouraged and want to immediately send it back. They would be making a HUGE mistake. I was about to return it myself because of that crazy REALITY look that it had on certain stations and formats. To my mind, my initial tweaking should have done the trick and solved the lighting problem. It is, after all, my fourth owned HDTV, one being a Sony XBR full array set, so I'm no stranger to tweaking.MORE THOUGHTS:The changes I eventually made was just counter-intuitive as first choice changes, hence, it took me two weeks to get it right. I don't have a college degree, but it seems to me that, if it took me two weeks to tweak the TV, Samsung could have, and should have; done it themselves before they put it out on the shelves. They know, or at least they should know, about the various swings regarding lighting amongst the various media sources. It just shouldn't be rocket science.

Reviews.Title: Worth every penny
Reviews.Author: Jason
Reviews.Content: Let me first state that while I didn't buy this product from Amazon, I felt it was worth leaving a review for this TV since buying a new set can be a complicated process, and I hope this review will make your buying process easier. Also, I happen to be primarily a gamer, so if you enjoy video games as well, this review might help you. To start, I'll give some general information, then dive into a more detailed discussion of the various settings and how I calibrated my TV.I'll get the obvious out of the way first: this TV is BEAUTIFUL. The first words that literally came out of my mouth when I turned on my Xbox 360 (even before I calibrated the video) were "Oh my God." Granted, I'm upgrading from a 4-year-old 720p 32" 60hz Sanyo, but even so -- the picture quality was notably impressive. Even a non-videophile (like myself) can appreciate this set. Blacks were black, whites were white. (Although looking back, I can see that my non-calibrated set looked non-ideal -- more on this later.) The audio, as to be expected with this sort of set, was somewhat disappointing -- the speakers are on the underside of the set, and I could tell right away that the sound was off. Calibrations to come!The set itself is easy to set up. Four screws put the base together, and another four connect it to the TV. I will say, though, that the set is VERY wobbly. A slight bump can make your set rock back and forth, so make sure to be VERY careful around it. As another downside, there are only two HDMI ports and one (!) slot for component/AV cables. What this means is, you can have component OR AV cables attached, but not both. The ports are surprisingly limited, so it's worth taking into account. If this isn't a problem, though, the TV definitely impresses. It's very lightweight, so you probably won't need to buy a new stand.So, on to the technical stuff. Again, if you're a gamer, these settings should help you get a spectacular picture; keep in mind, though, that everyone's different, and my preferences may not be the same as yours. Either way, these should be a good starting point.The TV has three main video settings: Dynamic, Standard, and Movie. The TV starts out at Standard, and you can change it to the other two. Dynamic greatly brightens the screen, and at first I thought I'd found my ideal setting. Upon closer inspection, however, one can see slight problems with colors -- some greens seemed too blue, even on the "Standard" color setting (not the same Standard as I listed above). Which brings me to my next issue -- Dynamic offers no option to manually tweak red, green, and blue levels, making it difficult to adjust. It's almost a case of "what you see is what you get."The audio also has several "preset" options: Music, Movie, Clear Voice, and Amplify. Clear Voice and Amplify seemed too muted, so I never even bothered with them. Music and Movie, on the other hand, increased sound quality (and volume) but, like with video, do not allow you to manually adjust the equalizer.Finally, we have the Samsung Auto Motion Plus. This setting controls the quality of the image during fast motion, and like everything else, it requires some tweaking to get just right. For example: say you're playing a first-person shooter. When moving the screen from left to right (or vice versa), this setting controls how smooth the motion is. On one setting, you have nice, smooth motion, but the top of the screen "tears," creating very noticeable graphical glitches. On the other end of the spectrum, the graphical glitches are removed, but the motion is back to blurry -- almost as if the TV doesn't have 120hz.Now then, I think it's worth noting the few problems I've noticed with the set in the months I've owned it:1. Vertical desync. This is the biggest thing, and I'm actually noticing it right now as I play Fallout 3. When moving through certain parts of the world, the screen will "jitter" and parts of the picture will become uneven. I'm not totally sure how to put it into words...there's no discoloration, there's just horizontal lines that move up and down across the image, making it look uneven. It only happens in certain situations, and only in certain games; I've never noticed it in Battlefield 3 multiplayer (I do see it sometimes in campaign, but only when scanning my screen across images that are large and close-up -- like buildings -- which is curious in and of itself), and I've never seen it in Halo 4, Enslaved, Mass Effect 3, or most other games either. It may be an issue with the AutoMotion Plus, but I'm not sure if it is, and it doesn't bother me enough to worry about too much.*UPDATE* The vertical desync stems from frame rate drops while playing certain games; if the Xbox or PS3 is unable to handle all the action on the screen, the frame rate will dip below 30 and the TV will be unable to consistently create a smooth image. Lowering or turning off Auto Motion Plus reduces the effect to a degree.2. Black levels. Black levels are difficult to get just right; sometimes you think you've got the right level of black, and then you notice certain scenes are too black, or too grey. I've noticed this quite a bit when calibrating the set for my Xbox 360 and PS3. In Fallout 3, I do get full, rich blacks when it seems like you should be getting them, but other times blacks seem too grey for my liking. If I increase the grey level or decrease brightness, however, the rest of the image can suffer. The PS3 calibrations were similar; in Uncharted, dark scenes (such as inside caves or tunnels) were extremely black at first, and I had to do quite a bit of adjustment to get them where I want.Something to keep in mind -- the Xbox 360 and PS3 have their own color calibration settings in the Display area. These settings (Reference Levels on 360, RGB Full Range on PS3) GREATLY impact the appearance of blacks on your image. Set Reference Levels to expanded or RGB Full Range to Full, and blacks are crushed. I have these settings on standard and limited, respectively, and have calibrated the set around those settings. The calibrations listed in my review are applied to both inputs for both consoles, and work fine.TL;DR of the last paragraph; the calibrations on my set are where they need to be. If they seem off, it's worth looking into the color settings on one's console and adjusting them if necessary.3. AutoMotion isn't everything I hoped. I touched on this a bit in my review; on the Smooth setting, the screen motion is very clear, but the "tearing" or "jittering" is even more prevalent. My Custom setting works fine for the most part, though; although motion isn't perfectly smooth, I barely notice it in most situations. And honestly, try looking left to right around your room. Objects blur a bit in real life, don't they? Anyway, I'm not sure is a Plasma is better for this (as I've never owned one), but this is still a nice feature and makes things look better than my old set.So where does all this leave us? These are the settings I'm using right now, and the TV looks and sounds as good as I think I can get it. This is the result of about four hours of tweaking. Also, note that I'm using HDMI to connect my consoles to the TV.EDIT 12/28/12:I've updated the video settings for the television; slight changes include lowering brightness, increasing gamma, resetting RGB sliders to default, and a few others. The changes create a vivid, bright image, but not one with too much brightness (my previous settings had the brightness levels a bit high, making blacks look gray in some areas).1. PICTUREMode: StandardBacklight: 20Contrast: 90Brightness: 44Sharpness: 35Color: 50Tint: G50/R50  1A. ADVANCED SETTINGS  Color Space: Auto  Gamma: +3  Dynamic Contrast: Off  Black Tone: Off  Flesh Tone: +4  Motion Lighting: Off  1B. WHITE BALANCE  R-Offset: 25  G-Offset: 25  B-Offset: 25  R-Gain: 25  G-Gain: 25  B-Gain: 25  1C. PICTURE OPTIONS  Color Tone: Cool  Size: Screen Fit  Digital Noise Filter: Off  HDMI Black Level: Either (This setting will depend on what sort of input you are using. Some inputs may default at Normal and not allow you to change it; others will let you set one or the other. Normal is a much brighter setting than Low, so you have to try both and see which works best for you. For example, I have my game systems on a setting that darkens the picture but expands the available range of color, so therefore I use the Normal (brighter) setting.  Film Mode: Off  LED Motion Plus: Off  1D. AUTO MOTION PLUS  Auto Motion Plus: Custom  Blur Reduction: 7  Judder Reduction: 5  NOTE CONCERNING AUTO MOTION PLUS: The higher this setting, the more vertical desync (which I mentioned earlier in the reciew) you will receive with certain games. For example, when playing Far Cry 3 on the Xbox 360, any scene which resulted in a frame rate drop would produce the vertical tearing. Lowering the Auto Motion Plus (or even turning it off) had an positive impact on the tearing, reducing it (but not eliminating it all together). For normal television viewing, the tearing won't be an issue, but if you notice it while playing a game, set the Auto Motion to Clear or Off.2. SOUNDMode: StandardSRS TruSurround HD: OffAuto Volume: Off  2A. EQUALIZER  100Hz: Two notches down from highest "+" setting.  300Hz: All the way to "+" setting.  1KHz: Two notches down from highest "+" setting.  3KHz: All the way to "+" setting.  10KHz: All the way to "+" setting.3. GAME MODE: OffAnd that's pretty much it. Blacks are black, white is white, and every color in-between seems as close to "normal" as I can get them. Again, these settings may require your own fiddling to get "just right," but this seems like a good starting point.Anyway, bottom line: the picture quality is superb. The negative I listed above aren't enough to warrant a detraction in stars when so many times I've been amazed by the quality of the picture being put before me. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Excellent "Basic" Television
Reviews.Author: B. A. Morehouse
Reviews.Content: It is telling when you have to describe televisions as "basic" or "smart" - just like cellular devices.The EH6000 is a "basic" television that, simply, fits a need. It is a television that doesn't pretend to be anything else. I don't really need it to be anything else, either. It certainly is my television, but I mostly use it as a monitor for my PC and consoles. It does a wonderful job for what I need it for, and that's the key. My consoles and PC do everything I'd want a "smart" television for anyway. I also have no need or desire for 3D. At this point in time, there are few panels that give the true theater experience, and they are all well outside of my price range.The picture is nice and sharp. Out of the box, it was set to "dynamic" color mode which I found so bright it washed out the picture. I set it to "standard" color mode, and it fits my environment just fine. If I upgrade from my yellow light bulbs to white, I may change my color settings. I haven't tried the "game" color mode yet; though, "standard" seems to work fine for the range of games I've tried on Steam, Origin, and my consoles.It took some trial and error to find the right fit for my PC's graphics settings, but I expected as much. However, I was pleased once everything was set up and running. I was immediately impressed with the LED back-lighting. It is, by far, superior to standard LCD panels. I never realized just how dim my previous television, also a Samsung, was until I turned down the brightness settings in ALL my games. The environments really pop, and they don't feel over-saturated with "forced" brightness.I didn't see it in the description at the time, but I was pleasantly pleased to see the audio outputs on the back. Yes, I used plural. It has optical, which I was expecting, and analog three-conductor phone (aka: headphone, stereo eighth-inch). I wish it was analog stereo phono (aka: RCA) instead, but I can live with it.With all this praise, one might think there were no drawbacks to reduce the overall star rating. Sadly, Samsung left one, glaring omission. It's not enough to return the television and shell out extra cash for a higher-end Samsung, but it is something to complain about. It only has 2 HDMI ports. Yes, it is in the description. I realized what I was buying when I purchased the television, but I really wish Samsung had included more HDMI ports. All of their 3D televisions that I looked at had 4 HDMI ports. Why? Why? Why?! Most consumers have more than two HDMI devices, and switches can cause a degradation in signal quality.Oh also, the product description states the EH6000 has one component and one composite input. The statement is a bit misleading. There is one component/composite input. That's right. You can use it as EITHER component or composite. It doesn't bother me, but other buyers may wish to be made aware.As a note, I have no way of testing the tuner. I live outside of off-the-air broadcast range, so there is no way, at this time, to properly test this function. In the past however, Samsung has built in excellent over-the-air tuners.

Reviews.Title: Almost great.
Reviews.Author: nickexperience
Reviews.Content: Just got this TV (46") set up yesterday and have been pretty pleased with it. I was excited to find a TV that presented a value proposition like this. The sacrifices I didn't mind making to save some $$$:I don't need tons of inputs.I don't need "Smart TV" functionality as I've always found standalone units (like my PS3) to be far more usable and far less frustrating then those embedded in the TV.I don't care how deep the TV is. It's not going on my wall and I've got plenty of front to back room for the TV. The thin bezel looks great.At first I was pretty much blown away by the picture quality, which shouldn't be surprising since I was upgrading from a 7 year old 32" 720p Olevia. But I did start to notice something that might ruin this TV for me. In very dark scenes (i.e. when Hulu Plus is loading), I've noticed the dreaded "banding" issue that plagued some of last year's Samsungs. Again, it's only in moments of pervasive darkness, but it is quite noticeable. Now I just have to decide if it's bad enough that it warrants dealing with the hassle of replacing the unit.Update (06/01/12): I put in a warranty repair request with Samsung to see if the panel can be replaced. Basically, the local repair agency is ordering a replacement panel and will come out to inspect next week. At that point, I'll find out if I have impossible standards for an $850 TV or if the panel is legitimately defective. Either way, I'll update here after.Update (06/04/12): I activated Comcast HD this weekend and made sure to watch some football replays on B1G Network. Unfortunately, it looked awful. Extremely cool picture quality to the point where whites were essentially just blue. I also noticed more motion issues (judder) regardless of the settings I used. These issues are noted in this review on televisioninfo dot com where the reviewer claims that the EH5000 actually performs significantly better when it comes to motion.I have delayed the service appointment because I now have the LG 47LM6700 showing up tomorrow. The price came down again and now it's only $100 more. I've read great technical reviews on the picture quality so I'm going to compare the two. If the LG wins, which I'm fully expecting, I'll be taking back the Samsung.Update (06/06/12): Well, the LG came yesterday and I set it up after work. I was immediately taken with the quality of the picture. In general, compared to the Samsung, the colors looked more accurate to me. As I watched during the evening in almost total darkness, I was really impressed by the utter lack of significant backlight bleeding or flashlighting of any sort. I'm no expert, but the picture looks great to me, and noticeably better than the Samsung. Of course, these TV's seem to be pretty different from set to set, but in this case, the choice is clear: the Samsung is going back today.

Reviews.Title: Excellent television, you will not be disappointed
Reviews.Author: JK Cal
Reviews.Content: I was originally looking for the D6000, but I wait too long and it went end of life.  I checked out the specs on the e series and they were the same as the d series.  I purchased the TV from VANNS who had no sales tax and no shipping cost.  So a great deal right off the top.  The TV showed up and took be about 30 minutes to unbox and setup.  The instructions were very straight forward and intuitive.  I had to do some tweaking with the color settings but that did not take long.The color on the set is absolutely amazing, I cannot believe how vibrant the colors are on the screen.  It feels like the people are standing in the room with you.  I love this TV, Samsung did a wonderful job on this set. I would buy this set again in a minute.  One thing to take into account is that I was not looking for a TV with 3D, WIFI or apps so this was a great fit for me.  If you are looking for a great TV for a good price and provides a true entertainment explosion for your eyes, this is the TV for you.

Reviews.Title: Incredibly Sharp Picture!
Reviews.Author: MSharpe
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV after weeks and weeks of research. In the 46" realm, I am confident the Samsung UN46EH6000 is by far the best option for the money. The picture is incredible, the quality the amazing and the color is unlike anything I've ever seen. One feature worth noting is the smooth picture movement -- you have to see it to understand it. Highly recommended LED HDTV!

Reviews.Title: VERY pleased with this 46" LED TV!
Reviews.Author: Jeff
Reviews.Content: Exchanged a new 50" Panasonic plasma TV Panasonic VIERA TC-P50U50 50-Inch 1080p Full HD Plasma TV for this set because the plasma TV simply couldn't produce a bright enough picture.Unpacking and assembling the pedastal to the TV was a simple matter. Unlike plasma sets, LCD/LED sets can be laid down flat. The pedastal has a little wiggle to it but I don't expect it to give me any trouble - it keeps the set perfectly level and straight. I found it necessary to unplug and then replug and power on my Comcast cable box to get a signal to HDMI port #1 and have had no trouble since the initial setup. HDMI port #2 correctly picked up my Bluray player. YOU MUST FIRST power on the Bluray player BEFORE attempting to switch the TV to port HDMI #2. If there is no live feed to the port, the TV simply refuses to switch to it.I decided to go straight to the THX Optimizer test patterns to do a consumer-level calibration. Most Disney movies with the THX logo on it will have the THX Optimizer (calibration test patterns) in the "Setup" menu of the movie disc. It doesn't have to be a Bluray title either, DVD movies will work just fine for a rudimentary calibration. Once I was happy with calibration, I made some further minor adjustments while watching a good channel. I can't stress enough that you must have a good channel! Don't expect commercials or standard TV channels to provide you with a picture worthy of adjusting settings to. Even a lot of so-called "HD" content on cable can be less than stellar. I suggest HDNET or your local live news for the best content. Also, understand that there are two HDMI ports so, if you calibrate for content from a DVD/Bluray player on one port, those settings won't be applied to HDMI port #2.I'm just in my first few days of ownership and am still making minor adjustments. I've found, for example, that I actually LOVE the "soap opera effect" these LED/LCD sets have on movie content! Viewing Netflix streaming and my DVDs and Blurays is like peeling the "film" off the screen so you can see "into" the reality of the movie as if you're right there! Some people don't like this effect - and Samsung gives you 3 main settings to choose from to help AND provides you with custom, granular controls so you can make it a personalized viewing experience no one else has. I'm using the "custom" settings with "8" for motion and "6" for judder. I find this combination gives me fairly stutter-free, blur-free motion, and just enough of the soap opera effect to make movies pop without over doing it. Just like color was an improvement over black and white (and you wouldn't set your color saturation to 100%), I feel these motion adjustments are an improvement - you just need to fine tune it to your liking.I'm VERY pleased with this TV! Anyone complaining of issues with the picture or even the sound have not explored the menu system to adjust it to their taste.

Reviews.Title: Spectacular TV!
Reviews.Author: Gary A. Rice
Reviews.Content: Had this TV for 2 weeks now and the picture is the best I have ever seen!  I don't need 3D or Internet apps.  Perfect for home tv use!My previous Samsung was fantastic as well!  It's now in my bedroom, still working great.  Any cons?  A couple of VERY minor ones:Build quality seems cheaper than my previous models.  Cheap, non swiveling stand is mounted to the tv with self tapping screws.  HDMI inputs stick out the side of the back, easy to strike and break, and only 2 at that. The manual is a multi-folding piece of paper in several languages.  VERY hard to use.  Previous was a solid book that you could read.As I said, very minor!  Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: Love My TV
Reviews.Author: D. Dahlbeck "Tappah"
Reviews.Content: My old TV died. It was a monster DLP number, and it was a Samsung. It had done the job for years and years, so I decided to go back to them.I did some research and I found this one. After some comparison shopping, I reluctantly bought it from Amazon. I was hesitant to buy a TV from the internet, but, looking back I do not know why.The thing arrived in the original box. I unpacked it, attached the stand (I am not a wall mount guy), plugged in my cable box, turned it on, and boom. Crystal clear HD.Now - the thing I really like about this TV is what it doesn't have. I think 3D is a fad, and did not want to pay for it. I think paying for a Smart TV is stupid since I have my PS3 and my Roku Player hooked up to it, giving me all of my services.I wanted a  great TV, just a TV. And I found it. Picture is awesome. Setup was easy. Over a year later, I have had ZERO problems with anything. Just a great product.

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: Music lover
Reviews.Content: I've had the 46 inch version of this TV for about a month now, and I am completely happy with it. My primary aim was to get a TV with a great picture but without all the "smart TV" features - don't need that.  This one fits the bill perfectly.It took a little tweaking to get the settings right, but it was worth the effort - once I got rid of the auto motion and LED motion gimmicks, the picture is great, with sharp colors and really deep black levels. I do think the current hype from TV manufacturers about 120/240Hz and motion compensation is just that, and more often than not does more harm than good. Without it, watching sports etc. on the TV is no problem whatsoever.A big plus in my opinion is the thin bezel that makes the TV look very professional and much more expensive than what I got it for, especially when wall-mounted. I wanted a matte screen due to the many windows in the room and this one is perfect for that.Two HDMI ports are sufficient in my setup, since this is a bedroom unit not meant for full home theater duty. The sound is OK, not great but adequate for normal viewing. The TV has analog audio (3.5mm jack) and digital audio (optical) outputs for connecting to an external sound system if needed. The user's manual is little more than a cursory explanation on a folded pamphlet, but the menu system is very intuitive and easy to use.  A great value TV!

Reviews.Title: Decent when available at a serious discount
Reviews.Author: almondpg
Reviews.Content: There is plenty all over the internet that has been said about this set, and I'd say that it's pretty much all true.  Here are some points that I'd like to emphasize.The soap opera effect when the set is at the default configuration is terrible, truly horrific.  Everyone looks like plastic dolls in a bad daytime drama.  It was obvious even to someone who is not typically discerning of such things.  The motion enhancement features do exactly what they say they do (noticeably), but that's not a good thing.  You absolutely must turn off all the motion processing crap and tweak the pictures settings.  Once done, the pictures looks pretty legit and definitely acceptable unless you're a serious videophile.The thickness of the set is a non-issue.  When viewed from an angle or front (the way you're actually going to) the bezel is very slim and the set looks great.It is a good thing that this set lacks apps etc.  Just get an AppleTV, Roku, etc.; you'll be better off and save money.The backlight uniformity is very good, much better than I've seen in any edge-lit set ever.The black levels and "naturalness" of the colors is not as good a a mid-range plasma and probably never will be on an LCD.  This is just a fact.  I wanted to get a mid-range Panasonic plasma originally, but my wallet ultimately decided differently.Though this is often the case on HDTV's I felt like this set is particularly sensitive to the quality of the input signal.  A very well encoded video looks great, but lesser bitrates really start to look fuzzy and full of artifacts more-so than I've noticed on other displays.  Perhaps this is actually a testament to the quality of this set, idk.Should anyone be wondering (as I was before purchasing) the analog audio output is pre-gain, meaning you need another way to control the volume of the audio that comes out of it (like a receiver).  I know this is not a normal thing to care about, but I am using self-powered studio monitors as my LR mains and if it were post-gain, I could have simplified the signal chain significantly.  There does not appear to be a menu setting anywhere to change this behavior.  Also, I'm not at all impressed with the quality of the DAC, so it's probably best that I get a receiver anyway.Overall, for what I paid during the Black Friday sale ($650) I think this TV is a good deal and meets my desire for a very barebones set with decent picture quality.  At $800 or whatever the set goes for normally, it might be worth shopping around more.

Reviews.Title: This is a pretty good TV
Reviews.Author: P. Thorkildsen "valhalla"
Reviews.Content: Arrived on time without damage.  No dead pixels.  The vid is fine.  There are six different presets for video that change the sharpness, brightness and contrast of the vid.  All this can be changed manually as well.  The sound is surprisingly good - I wouldn't want to use them in as the sole speakers in a hi-fi setup, but they have more low end than I expected.  Yes there are limited inputs - one HDMI, one DVI, and one five wire RCA jack (aka color stream, three rca vid and stereo left and right).  I have no need for more inputs.The only stereo output is a 1/8" phone plug - it would be nice to have rca jacks for stereo output, so you could hook it up to a stereo without all the adapter headaches.  I have not set this up yet (the stereo out) so I cannot provide comments about the line - out audio.  I will update this review after I get that all set up.So far this TV has been working fine and I have no problems with it.  I give it four stars instead of five because of the limited inputs / outputs.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding
Reviews.Author: T. Roberts "Hostage Negotiator"
Reviews.Content: Bills review says it all and I completely agree. Found it onsale locally for $899.00. Outstanding picture, sound is good overall. We could not be happier. Perfect size for the bedroom. We  have a 55" LED that is in the living room. I read, studied and looked high and low and this is one great set. I could care less about all the internet features as they can be found on BR Players. The object is to WATCH and be pleased with what you see and pleased we are.  3 days old and love it.

Reviews.Title: Reasonably good value for the money
Reviews.Author: Azgrin
Reviews.Content: We just set up this tv yesterday as part of a larger effort to cut the cord with cable and go with streaming video through a Roku 3 and over-the-air HDTV via a Mohu Leaf. Overall, the number of inputs/outputs were sufficient for us because we've got an A/V receiver that connects everything. I think the value for the money (screen size, 1080p, etc.) is really good.BUT....Our experience is that the factory settings for the picture are terrible and required considerable adjustment for us to be satisfied. We've got it everything adjusted now, which is why we're willing to give it 4 stars and not lower.Three things that were discovered while tinkering with all the picture settings seemed to make a significant difference:1. The factory settings really made everything look like a daytime soap opera in that the colors were washed out. What seemed to help was to set the whole picture to the "Warm1" in the "picture options" submenu. It also helped in the "Advanced" menu to turn the "black tone" to "darker."2. The picture also seemed almost jumpy (like it was skipping almost) with the factory settings. At first, I thought it was the streaming video (i.e., a problem w/ our high speed internet) but DVDs had the same issue. What seemed to fix that was in the "picture options" menu, under "auto motion plus" was to switch that to "Custom" with Blur Reduction = 10 and Judder Reduction = 0.3. The adjustments made to the picture are specific to the particular input (e.g., you'll have to adjust for the TV, then the DVD, then other devices, etc.), so be sure to keep track of what you're doing that looks good. Maybe this is obvious to everyone else, but it took us a while to realize it.Hopefully this will save you a bit of time if you buy this product & don't like how the factory settings look on the picture. We can't really comment on the sound quality because we have the TV connected to surround sound speakers.

Reviews.Title: Another Great Product From Samsung
Reviews.Author: Nthstar
Reviews.Content: All I can say is that I have 4 Samsung Tvs and a microwave... I love them. When my mom and dads DLP Tv (of another make) went out, I told them to let me find them another Tv and they said fine and told me topurchase it for them and I said ok. I landed on the UN46EH6000 and bought it. THEY LOVE THE TV, now my mom anddad are 82 years old and dont need a smart Tv or internet tv, just something they could use and understand,butnot only did they get that, but also a very nice picture to boot. Thanks for that Samsung! Now it might be my turnto upgrade, that ES8000 is looking pretty good to me Hmmmm  Mark

Reviews.Title: Good Basic TV
Reviews.Author: Zach K
Reviews.Content: When I was looking for a TV, I wanted only the basics. This one fit the bill perfectly. I have my Xbox and computer attached to it via HDMI and that provides all the entertainment I need. The sound and video quality are good. The only minor complaint is that it takes a few seconds for the TV to turn on or even respond to the fact that you turned it on. Besides that, it is an all-around good, no-frills TV.

Reviews.Title: Great Tv
Reviews.Author: Shwetha
Reviews.Content: We are primarily using it to watch Hulu and Netflix. The HD quality is very good. The initial set up was easy. I will recommend for others. You can't go wrong with Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV for this price.
Reviews.Author: Daniel S.
Reviews.Content: We bought this 46 inch right after X'mas when the price came down below $600. Set up was really a breeze - we did not read the menu at all. The picture is sharp and clear. Colors are vivid. The motion is smooth.  It took us some time to fine-tune the brightness and colors though - still looks too bright.  We are getting a Wi-Fi blu-ray DVD, so we can save a bit by not getting the smart version. The reception is excellent even with a cheap antenna.  The TV stand is optional and it is kind of flimsy and cheap-looking. The speakers are at the back of the TV, and the sound is bit disappointing.  This is our second set of Samsung (our old one is a LCD, still working well after 8 years).  The overall value is excellent for the price.

Reviews.Title: First flat screen TV
Reviews.Author: Bookie
Reviews.Content: This product came promptly (within 24 hours with Standard shipping!), was perfectly packed, and set up easily. The picture is wonderful, and it's a perfect size screen for a midsize living room. It was also well rated in Consumer Reports.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Product!
Reviews.Author: James D. Crouch
Reviews.Content: Fantastic product.  Excellent price.  Quick delivery.  I had it un-boxed, assembled, connected and fully operational in less than an hour, and I'm not a techie.  Beautiful picture!  I couldn't be happier.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: K. Breon "KFB"
Reviews.Content: This TV is Amazing!No it's not smart but why pay extra for something my PS3 does already/better than Tv's that have it built in.The picture is crystal clear. I use an antenna with it and the HD picture is perfect. Also use a PS3 with it and it works perfectly.Helpful Tip***** Ability to turn the screen off and just listen to music is a nice way to save some energy. To do it press: Menu>Setup>Eco Solution>Energy savings>Picture off. just press any button on the remote other than the volume button to turn the screen back on*** This should also work on other new TV's as well.I currently just use the built in speakers and I think they provide a great sound. No there is no deep bass but hey you are listening through a TV. Better sound than my old Tube TV.I would recommend this TV!

Reviews.Title: PERFECT PICTURE!
Reviews.Author: Roy A. Midyett "adv. amateur"
Reviews.Content: This review is for the 46 inch: after agonizing whether to go to an LED after being a Plasma fanatic, I finally sat down at my daughter's LED at looked at some movies and DVDs, and the picture was spectacular, and that's without being adjusted to my preferences. I don't need the interconnectivity (that's all on my Bluray player) I just wanted an excellent picture, and this TV has it. I was worried about the "video look" or "soap-opera" effect, but I just disabled the auto-motion, and movies look like movies, and I don't have any bad motion effects. The picture on Bluray movies is absolutely spectacular; the over the air broadcasts (news, sports and TV shows) are outstanding also. I fine tuned the DVD mode with the Spears and Munsil test disc, and also the Disney WOW disc. The remote is fine (the backlite isn't very bright) and there are lots of deep adjustments if you want to go crazy. I guess my only  minor complaint (comparared to my Panasonic Plasma) is that on older 4/3 full screen stuff, if you want to stretch it to full screen, it cuts a tiny bit off the top and bottom; this is really the only negative I can think of. Again, this has a spectacular picture.

Reviews.Title: Crisp and Clean but, don't call for help.
Reviews.Author: G. Petersen
Reviews.Content: I'll make this short as there's nothing much more to be said about this Samsung UN46EH6000 that hasn't already been stated.  It's a 'no frills' HDTV with an absolutely outstanding picture and its just what we wanted as we're not into all of the gadgetry of wireless, 3D etc.  I have only one problem with the set and I'm hoping that Samsung tech. support can resolve it, and that is: I've attached a ZVOX 555 sound bar (highly recommended) to this TV.  But, when I went into the Samsung's setup and disabled it's internal speakers (in order to make best use of the sound bar) an annoying thing is now happening, which is, each time I use my  'Dish' universal remote to adjust the sound or mute the ZVOX, the Samsung receives the signal as well and, instead of ignoring it (because I've turned it's speakers off) it throws up a large box on it's screen warning me that it's speakers are turned off!  To make it worse, the box stays on the screen for several seconds.  And, for as much as I manipulate the sound, this has turned into a real issue.  I'll keep my fingers crossed that Samsung's tech. support can remedy this.  If any of you have experienced and resolved this, please tell me!  Otherwise, buy this set if you don't need bells, whistles and any more than 2 HDMI ports.Udate - May 25, 2013:  Again, this TV has a great picture but, I'm now forced to downgrade my rating from 5 to 1 star due to the following:  The issue that I described above (warning box on screen when adjusting the sound) has been completely ignored by Samsung's technical support group.  I've sent more than a dozen emails to them describing the problem over the last month.  From those, I received only one response and then..., nothing.  All of my subsequent emails were been ignored.  I'm concerned that Samsung does not understand that 'service after sale' is the cornerstone of any manufacturing corporations business plan.  I have no idea why they won't help me but, it is what it is.  I wrote a letter to the CEO of Samsung describing my problem and the lack of response from his company.  To date, I've received no response from that letter.  So, for now, I guess I have to put up with the problem.  My next TV?  Well, it won't be a Samsung.Update - June 1, 2013:  A week ago, I logged into the Samsung Web site and left a review of this TV.  The review mirrored my comments above.  Today, I got the following back from Samsung:"Thanks for leaving a review. Unfortunately, your review did not meet our posting guidelines.  This may be because it contained references to other products; or to pricing, ordering, delivery or other customer service issues."So, it seems that Samsung can't allow objective and constructive criticisms of their products on their corporate Web site.  That's unfortunate.  But, it is in keeping with their culture of 'no service after sale' so, at least they're consistent.Update - June 14, 2013:  As I stated above in my May 25 update, I'd written a letter to the CEO of Samsung as I could not get any assistance through traditional methods.  Today, I received a call from "Grace" from "Samsung Corporate" who said she was in possession of my letter and wanted to know what she could do to help.  (Interesting what a letter to a CEO will accomplish.)  Interestingly, she also stated that she had copies of all of the emails I'd sent to Samsung via their customer help site.  She apologized for the fact that I'd not received replies (she actually suggested that they went into my email 'junk' folder) and asked if she could have technical support call me within the hour.  I agreed.Shortly, I received a call from (not one, but two) techs. who were interested in discussing my issue.  They agreed with my observations that, when this set (they said "all their sets") have their internal speakers shut off, any subsequent signal sent to the TV via a remote control to adjust volume or mute causes the TV to display a large "NOT AVAILABLE" pop-up banner on the screen.  The said they've had to do this because customers will turn off the speakers (forget that they've done so) and call Samsung to complain.  I said that I understood the issue however, I couldn't understand why they would inconvenience the majority of their customers because of a few with 'user' issues.  I said if they couldn't release on this "NOT AVAILABLE" pop-up banner, couldn't the same message be conveyed (to the user error group) via a very small and transparent message at the bottom of the screen as to why there was no sound?  They said they understood but, that change was out of their area of responsibility.Their suggestion to resolve my issue was to reprogram my 'Dish' remote so that the 'Aux' button would control only the sound bar volume and not the TV.  I told them that I'd thought of this alternative myself and, even though it was doable it's not as seamless as it could be and, to me, too fussy.So, I give them credit for calling me to discuss this design flaw but, I'm wondering why it took a letter to their CEO to make it happen.  I've decided to leave my rating at it's 'one star' level as I'm not happy with the amount of energy I've had to expend pursuing this issue with little to no results.

Reviews.Title: Breathtaking color, great sound
Reviews.Author: Rick N.
Reviews.Content: This is a great tv!I decided on this tv because it was a reasonably priced led tv, and nearly all of the reviews that I saw on-line raved about the picture. The reviews are so right. The picture is breathtaking, and by going with this model, and not the super-slim upper line series, you get wonderful sound. No need for a sound bar, the built in speakers and the SRS sound is a joy to listen to. The remote is easy to navigate. I do wish that there were more than 2 HDMI ports - but that before I bought it. I couldn't be happier.

Reviews.Title: loved it until, only, one and a half years later it shut itself off and would not come back on for absolutely no reason.
Reviews.Author: Margaret S.
Reviews.Content: The things i'm finding on you tube and the internet in general confirm there is a major defect with samsung hd tv's all sizes,one day the thing just shuts off and won't come back on, red light blinks on and off at random, but no action other than that.  People replace capacitors, and eventually mother boards.  It seems they are all susceptible to the same problem, and samsung denies all responsibility.  We now own a very large very expensive piece of crap.  Fix it for about $300 more, only after 1 1/2 years, or pay someone to haul it away. Caveat emptur ~ everytime you turn around another piece of electronic equipment broken.  It's sickening.

Reviews.Title: 46" Samsung LCD with amazing picture quality
Reviews.Author: Christopher K. Sluder "Xioticin"
Reviews.Content: When I first got this TV, the first thing I did was hook it up to my PC to check out what some of my favorite games looked like on it. At 1080p, the image quality with maxed settings was breathtaking! I was so very happy with the quality of picture that I started looking into other ways to really flesh out my purchase. Thus began the assembly of my home theater system...After purchasing speakers, a receiver, and a blu ray player, I found out what I was missing out on. Blu Rays on this TV are just astounding quality! With the whole setup, it is quite the experience. Netflix HD is a must have to enjoy this TV daily unless you want to pay quite a bit for Comcast HD. I find that standard def comcast does of course look rather bad on it, but it will look bad on any HD because it is Standard Definition Signal.The inputs are lacking, this is very true. That is why I went ahead and bought a receiver so that it could handle all of my inputs and adjust them as needed instead of relying on the limits of the TVs settings. When paired with a receiver, this TV as a display is just about perfect to my eyes. It came with no visual defects nor scuffs. It now rests firmly on my wall where it has been mounted for almost a year. If you do plan to mount it, do all the measuring and drilling first and then get a friend or two to help you hang it as it could be dangerous to attempt alone.For the price, I would recommend this TV for just about any setup. The larger screen sizes I assume have the same quality panel and would work in a much larger room, but this size would probably be about as big as one would ever want in a bedroom.

Reviews.Title: Great TV at a Great Amazon Price
Reviews.Author: Frank A. Morabito
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV for my bedroom and have been very happy with it. Great picture and very good sound quality. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: great value
Reviews.Author: nyc shopper
Reviews.Content: great picture, nice stand and design, good price,big enough for a great view and not too overwhelming for the room.2 output connections are not ideal if you want to attach game systems, etc - will have to get splitters, but most tvs I looked at in the size range were similar.

Reviews.Title: PERFECT
Reviews.Author: Jacob Clark "Jacob"
Reviews.Content: I picked this television as it was the highest user rated on Amazon. Now I know why it is so highly rated. I did not want a smart TV and wanted minimal bells and whistles.  This is perfect.  The picture quality is amazing.  It is light, beautiful and simply perfect.  Their is nothing I dislike about it.  Perfect, perfect, perfect.  If you are debating between a few, look no further, this is the best.  I think it is a great deal for a Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Amazing picture
Reviews.Author: sir campsalot
Reviews.Content: I was very hesitant to buy a tv without seeing it in person first. After shopping around in local stores I couldn't find a TV I liked so I came back to Amazon and I had 5 different TV's I was considering. I decided that this TV had what I was looking for in specs and size.  Plus it had the highest stars in the reviews. So I figured with Amazons great return policy I'd take a gamble.  The picture on this TV is absolutely amazing it's so life like you feel that the people are in your living room instead of on the TV. Plus it looks great with the thin bezel around the screen. I happily add another 5 star review to a great product.

Reviews.Title: A reasonable quality for this price
Reviews.Author: Validator
Reviews.Content: The TV was easy to set up as I was already used to from my former Samsung TVs. After picture calibration (I got the settings from internet publications) the picture was OK, just not thazt crispy and naturally colored as I was used to from my former LCD Samsung TV. For this reason I gave 4 out of 5 stars.All over all I am satisfied, especially if I am looking to the price quality relation it is a good deal and would recommend this model.

Reviews.Title: Listen less apps less problems
Reviews.Author: Alex Paradis
Reviews.Content: "Smart tv's" focus on features and less on picture quality.  But this one isn't in danger of that just pure 1080p quality top notch television!  Ultra thin and extra light simple easy nice all rounded tv

Reviews.Title: Not a bad TV for the price, but I prefer my Sony
Reviews.Author: Brad Swick
Reviews.Content: I bought this Samsung for the bedroom on a recommendation from my sister who has been very happy with her 50" version of the same model.  It's not a bad TV, but I prefer the picture quality of my Sony KDL-52V5100 that I have in the living room.  The Sony picture quality was great right out of the box.  I didn't have to play with the settings at all.  On this Samsung the picture quality was pretty bad out of the box with a lot of jutter.  I played around with every setting before I discovered that the main problem was the Motion Plus system.  Once the Auto and LED Motion Plus were turned off the picture quality was much better and more realistic.  With the Motion Plus system on the picture looked very fake.  It's hard to describe, but my wife said it best when she said everything looked like a day time TV soap opera.  The images looked very flat like everything on the screen was a cardboard cut out without any depth.  With Motion Plus off the image quality is much better, but I can't tweak it to look as good as my Sony did right out of the box.

Reviews.Title: Long time without HD, very happy
Reviews.Author: Anthony Lawrence "Unixish stuff"
Reviews.Content: We've delayed this purchase for many years.  We had an expensive Panasonic CRT set from the 90's that gave us a really excellent picture that seemed better to us than any HD TV we'd see in the stores, and the prices and features of the HD TV's kept improving, so we just waited.This past year, we started looking seriously.  We initially thought we wanted a 42 inch, but saw this model on Amazon at the right price, so we bought it.Like other reviewers, we saw no need for "smart tv".  We have Roku (had to buy a new HD one) and all we ever use is Netflix, so why do we need Smart?  We don't.As to the limited inputs, again, we only need cable and Roku.  If we needed more (I might buy an Apple TV box later), they make switches for that.Set up was easy and quick.  I had been warned that I'd have to make major settings adjustments because (as people explained) "they come from the factory set up for bright showrooms".  Well, the first question the setup asked was "Showroom or Home" so that was a complete non-issue.  The most difficult part of this was getting it out of the box.  You need a screwdriver to put the base on and that's it.What really made me happy was the controls.  The basic functions for picture and sound settings are quickly available through a Tools button.  My wife, who had an difficult time with the complicated controls on our old set, understood this in seconds.  I gave her a quick intro and then left her while I ran out to get us pizza; when I go back she was completely comfortable with everything without even looking at the paper instructions.We watched a few hours of Netflix and then switched to regular TV to catch the news before bed - it's on composite right now as Verizon won't be here with the new HD STB for a week, but even composite is very nice compared to our old TV.We are happy!

Reviews.Title: It is a GREAT TV for the price I paid!!!
Reviews.Author: Chad C.
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV when everyone had it on sale for less than $600. It is worth every penny and the only problem with the TV is that it makes movies look too real. I like movies to look like movies and not like they're showing you how the movies is made. Other than that, LOVE IT!!! The TV is crystal clear and the 240 clear motion allows you to miss nothing on your favorite sporting event. Buy this TV if you are looking for one this size!!

Reviews.Title: Great for the right application
Reviews.Author: hommytoffman
Reviews.Content: This was my first LED tv, upgrading from my Samsung plasma. First and foremost, the picture quality is outstanding! Deep blacks, vibrant colors, and it's great for fast moving images. The 240CMR looks as good as any 240 hz tv I've put my eyes on. Thicker than some slim LEDs out there but it's all relative (maybe 4 inches thick instead of 2.5). The automatic brightness adjustment is a new feature to me and an absolute godsend! The room where I have this TV set up has a west facing window and is frequently used for movie nights, but the brightness is always just right now.I will issue a few warnings though. This tv is absolutely perfect for my application, but the ports on the back of this tv are VERY limited. Two HDMI in, one USB in, one component in, and two optical out. That's it. Mine is running in my home theater with receiver so this is fine for me, just make sure this won't cause any problems with your set up. This TV also does not feature any smart apps, so if you don't have another source for your Netflix you won't be fixing that problem here.That being said I couldn't recommend this TV more. You can pay more for a similar tv but you won't find better picture quality, just more bells and whistles. Stream your bells and whistles through your Xbox and hook yourself up with this outstanding monitor.

Reviews.Title: Typical Samsung Quality
Reviews.Author: OlTex
Reviews.Content: Was looking for older "dumb" LED TV, but previously "wish-listed" touch-of-color model sold out, and this was compromize;  have several Samsung televisions, and like them all.  Purchased this for new install in new house, connected to Dish Hopper system.  Picture quality on this model is superior to other brands have looked at, and appears almost 3D--requires a little tweaking of settings to bring out richer color (seems typical of LED's).  Has enough HDMI inputs for my needs, and like the USB port for viewing movies and pictures.  All-in-all, am pleased with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic picture quality for even regular DVDs
Reviews.Author: Hema T&T
Reviews.Content: We bought this TV for my in-laws for their informal sitting room.. they LOVE it! The picture quality is amazing and it plays all formats of movies - and we used several formats for download.  We havent tried the blue ray dvds, but its fantastic with regular dvds, much more for blue ray! the refresh rate is pretty fast so pictures are clear and crisp.  Highly recommended small tv!

Reviews.Title: Great tv for the price
Reviews.Author: Josh R Hohman
Reviews.Content: Great picture quality. Got it for a good price on cyber Monday. Only downfall is it only has two hdmi ports.

Reviews.Title: One of the best LED TVs for the price.
Reviews.Author: Joe N
Reviews.Content: After using this TV for about a week, i've had zero issues with it. Perfect display, amazing picture quality during gaming, and great sound. Many options to configure with picture color/sound equalizer.Only cons so far would be that there are only two HDMI ports. This isn't a big deal since I have an HD cable box and a PS3, two is all I need. But for some, maybe get a HDMI adapter/hub.Also, the only negative would be sound outputs. So far, with previous televisions i've had, you can use an AUX cord and plug speakers (Bose Companion II) right into the TV and when you adjust the TV volume, it adjusts the external speakers as well. This TV unfortunately does not do that. Not really a big deal though.Overall, this is an amazing TV for the price and I would recommend it for anyone.

Reviews.Title: Picture perfect
Reviews.Author: Kathleen Burr
Reviews.Content: I chose to give this tv 5 stars because the picture is sharp and beautiful.  It was easy to set up and easy to operate.

Reviews.Title: Amazing!!!!
Reviews.Author: Jake
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv on cyber Monday and have loved it ever since. The picture is incredible and all of my blueray movies look great. No problem with fast paced action games or sports. The Dark Knight Trilogy blew me away. Setup could not have been easier and the remote is simple to use. Great buy !

Reviews.Title: Amazing picture quality
Reviews.Author: Brickhaus
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is so good that is looks like you're watching a live play rather than a movie. It has the amazing ability to read .mkv files from a flash drive too!

Reviews.Title: Samsung 46 Inch "Basic" UN46EH6000
Reviews.Author: DLynch
Reviews.Content: In short, the picture quality of this TV is stunning. It makes me not want to call it basic at all. If the stock settings are not what you want, you have the options to change just about every setting to make the picture exactly how you want it. If you already have a "smart" blu-ray player (and even if you don't), this TV is the best way to go. It will cost you less than it's "smart" tv counterparts and will leave you with nothing else but beautiful picture and sound quality. After all, this is why we buy TV's in the first place, I don't need to check facebook on my TV. This TV makes for a perfect home entertainment experience without the unessential expensive extras.

Reviews.Title: Soap Opera Effect Forever
Reviews.Author: Jasonn
Reviews.Content: I owned this TV for a week until I got sick of the digital video look that it gave all movies.  I tried everything to get it to look like film (like it's supposed to).  I turned off all Auto Motion Plus features, yet the problem persisted. I tried "game mode", I tried using Auto Motion Plus and adjusting it in custom mode - I tried everything. I could make the problem less severe, but it never totally went away.  It seems that new LCD TVs are making up for their refresh rate shortfalls by adding a bunch of features that make all moving objects look ultra fast.  There is no way to change this.  Saving Private Ryan should not look like it was shot on digital video.  So I returned it and purchase a Panasonic plasma.  Movies now look like what they're supposed to look like; 24 frames per second smoothness.  If you're a movie lover, I don't recommend buying this TV.

Reviews.Title: Great TV so far
Reviews.Author: bl
Reviews.Content: Sound is excellent, as is the picture. This is my first HDTV, so maybe I am easily impressed. Could use a few more HDMI plugs, and the two that exist are not optimally placed. So far, however, I am quite glad I bought it.

Reviews.Title: pencil like lines, vertical and horizontal
Reviews.Author: paul
Reviews.Content: good TV except when arrived had vertical and horizontal lines. Called Samsung got technician to come and replaced the panel with new one.  works fine after that. Samsung honors the warranty, excellent service.  Had a previous Samsung Tv delivered with broken panel due to shipping not Samsung's fault.Had to return it to seller

Reviews.Title: johndman
Reviews.Author: John C. Nepomuceno "Masterblaster"
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV last month so far I am extremely happy with the quality of the picture and the surround sound performance. For the price of this TV I cannot complain and the quality of the overall performance. I've had samsung 55" before buying this for our bedroom it's still holding with no problems at all. Samsung is the best TV available on the market today.

Reviews.Title: Couldn't be happier
Reviews.Author: PH Bible Student
Reviews.Content: We upgraded to this TV from an older (2004) TV. The clarity of this TV is really amazing--when we're watching movies, it's almost as if the people are right there in the room with us!When I was setting up the TV initially, there was a bit of bright flashing around the edges of the TV, but after I got everything set up we have had no issues of any kind. Just a fabulous picture, and the built-in sound isn't bad either.I love the thin edges around the picture--it saves space and looks great!Note: our TV has the TS02 panel version from Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Okay LED HDTV
Reviews.Author: Terrance Pierre
Reviews.Content: The item came on time and well packaged also the price was really nice but the picture quality should have been better for a LED HDTV. I got some picture quality adjustment from reading someone on amazon reviews but i am still not satified with the quality. I probably did not get that quality adjustment good as yet.I am still trying...

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: JustaDude
Reviews.Content: This TV ROCKS.  After reading the other reviews before purchasing, I was aware that some modification of the base settings were required.  Menu is intuitive and easy to navigate.  The remote is very nice, I love the fact that you can backlight the remote buttons if your like me and don't memorize the key layout on the remote. One heck of a upgrade from a 32 inch CRT based TV!  Some of the reviews mentioned that the sound quality could be at issue but after a couple of days of wearing in the sound has gotten to the point where I am rarely going over 30 on the sound.  It's not a smart TV but that wasn't a concern for me anyway.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV, was broken
Reviews.Author: Jennay
Reviews.Content: The TV is pretty nice, however it arrived with a faulty HDMI port.  It flickers black when I watch my blu ray player which is very frustrating.  The good news is apparently Samsung will be sending an in-home repairman to check it out.  I would have been VERY upset if I had to lug this thing around town.  I've been dealing with the support via online chat.  Pretty good so far.  Very frustrating that I have this issue with a brand new TV, though.  For that I give it 3 stars.  Hopefully support will go easily and I'll get this brand new TV fixed.

Reviews.Title: This HDTV was a fantastic buy. Low price + High quality
Reviews.Author: Charles
Reviews.Content: As HDTV sets are growing in size and dropping in price this Samsung TV is a real steal. The angle at which you view this TV isn't much of an issue at all. I've stood across the room, low to the ground and to the far sides of the TV and the quality did not diminish nor did the color.It features 2 HDMI ports, composite cable input as well as a usb port.The bottom right directional button for using the TV's menu and turning it on without a remote is a different an fun feature.This TV was really easy to put together and the stand has been very stable. In less than 5 minutes I had this TV out of the box, stand screwed in and into my wall unit connected to my cable. The color and size are perfect for almost any modern.One notable part of this TV that I very much enjoy is the volume. At just 7 the volume is quite loud and great for watching alone if you don't have a surround sound system set up in your home. At 15-20 I can hear it over people making a large amount of noise whether it be construction upstairs from my home or people cooking and chatting sitting right next to me while I watch.This TV is fantastic for home entertainment for a family of any size and very affordable for it's large size.

Reviews.Title: Great Value Purchase
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: The series of TV is a great value purchase. It is thicker than most newer TV's but has a great picture; no blur. The best part about this buying this TV though was buying from Amazon. The packaging was a bit beat up, I let Amazon know and they went about making the experience hyper fantastic. They basicaly gave me some great options and let me pick. Amazon was $80 cheaper than my wholesale club and, of course, the TV was brougt to my door.

Reviews.Title: Absolute best TV for the price.
Reviews.Author: Dario G
Reviews.Content: I just purchased the 46 inch model of this Samsung TV yesterday at my local Bestbuy and short of the defective TV remote which was swapped out for another, this TV is AMAZING!Sure it lacks a lot of the flashy functionality you'd get out of a conventional "Smart TV" but who cares? I have a PS3 connected to this and it serves as my Netflix, Amazon on demand and BluRay / DVD player. On to the calibration, I decided to follow Jason's recommendations in the comments below and found those settings to be pretty spot on. I personally wanted the blacks to be a little darker so I went with "Darker" setting as opposed to Jason's "Dark" recommendation.First movie I watched on it was Tron and holly hell, the picture on this TV is unbelievable!  All of the colors were vibrant, crisp and clear. Loaded up Call of Duty Black Ops 2 and became fully immersed, I'm having problems finding one thing about this TV I don't like, It really is the best you can buy for the price.The only CON I can think of is the remote, it just looks and feels cheap and sometimes when going through the various settings on the tv, if you press the buttons fast like I do, the TV will initiate this rapid mode that makes it difficult to key in precise values. The threshold needs to be adjusted in a future firmware release in my opinion.Anyhow, do yourself a favor, buy this TV, you're not going to find anything better with a name brand for this price.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: drzaat
Reviews.Content: Just got this today.  Previously, I had a 32" Panasonic LCD TV.  The difference is amazing.  As another reviewer noted, the factory settings produce a picture that is too "real."  I messed around with the settings to tone that down a bit, and am quite satisfied with the results.  The detail is incredible.After ordering this, I ran across a couple professional reviews which were somewhat disparaging.  I must disagree.  I can't get over how sharp and clear the picture is.Of course, it lacks some features that "smart" TVs have; however, I have a Blu-ray player which handles those things, so I really don't need the TV to do them too.  My amp has all the HDMI connections I could want, so the fact that this TV only has two is also not a problem.I think it's a great deal, and I'm more than happy that I purchased it.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: G. S. Jones
Reviews.Content: I purchased mine refurbished.  I spent some time setting up the TV.  Once I dialed in the setting, the picture is just amazing.  This is about the best TV you can get without all the smart features.  Bought a BluRay player with the smart features and saved.  Great deal!!

Reviews.Title: stopped working after a year
Reviews.Author: maryann sullivan
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV 14 months ago. Two weeks ago when i turned the tv on,I would get sound and then eventually the picture.then all sound and no picture. Now nothing happens when i turn the TV on. Upon investigation, the " sound, no picture" seems to be a common problem with this TV as well as some other Samsung TVs.  Needless to say, Samsung was no help because the TV was no longer in warranty. Based upon the great reviews this TV had, I expected it to last a lot longer.

Reviews.Title: No issues at all.
Reviews.Author: Samuel A. McKinnon
Reviews.Content: Use this in the bedroom.  Have no complaints.  Oh, I guess I wished it swiveled on the base.  Don't know why they don't do that anymore.

Reviews.Title: Great picture.
Reviews.Author: Diane Hardesty
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV. My only complaint is that it doesn't have enough inputs. I would have liked it more if the audio out was variable but this is a non-issue as I use a home theater system that controls the volume just fine.

Reviews.Title: Almost Perfect
Reviews.Author: Alan
Reviews.Content: Bought it because I needed a new, flat and bigger TV.It has great image and works perfectly for me, just didn't give 5 stars because it has only two HDMI inputs so I cannot connect all my devices at the same time. Besides that, it is a great product. I have it for about a year now.Really fast shipping and delivery.Thank you

Reviews.Title: Great picture
Reviews.Author: Slk52
Reviews.Content: Nice size, great picture, we put it in the lanai outside in Florida. Bought a cover for it for weather protection

Reviews.Title: Bought this for my folks
Reviews.Author: Charles D Taylor
Reviews.Content: It's a good tv. Good black, good color. Good contrast. They love the picture and how easy it is to use (they're older and don't care much for gee whiz technology; although, this tv has it as my daughter shows them when she visits).

Reviews.Title: Fantastic!
Reviews.Author: john r fisgus
Reviews.Content: If all you are looking for is size with good picture quality, this is your next screen,Its not a smart tv,its not the thinnestall you pay for is the size & quality

Reviews.Title: Great Quality
Reviews.Author: sweetsixteen
Reviews.Content: Samsung is by far and away my favorite for televisions. I have 3 of them in my house with the biggest one being a 60 inch.  I get a lot of compliments on the picture quality and color...so much so, one person had to sell his tv and get this one.  They are very user friendly as well. Two thumbs up for Samsung!

Reviews.Title: After a year.
Reviews.Author: Peter Mcmillan
Reviews.Content: One star off for not great speakers. Otherwise love the picture. The speakers work ok, but my cheapie (for then) 2007 37" with front facing speakers has much better sound. Would have liked one more hdmi, but a 3-1 splitter fixes that. Out of the box movie watching not great. About 30 minutes following suggestions posted online fixed that (picture was too like live tv). I'll probably buy a soundbar in January and will update then.Updated 4/6/2014TV still working well.I got a JBL Cinema SB100 soundbar - this seems (to my not too critical ear) to be a perfect match for this TV. Search around as the prices on this vary wildly. I actually bought in a big box store for much less than I could find elsewhere. Works with the TV remote, or the one provided.

Reviews.Title: Great View!
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: I love this TV. It has a great vivid screen! The speakers are very nice for a TV. Fast refresh rate!

Reviews.Title: Approaching 2 years and no issues.
Reviews.Author: Paulmeister
Reviews.Content: After being impressed with the color depth and brightness vs. a pair of g276hl monitors (very nice as well), I decided to donate the monitors to my parents for Christmas as an upgrade and snagged a pair of UN46EH5000's (virtually identical, with slightly different bottom bezel and 120 hz vs 240 on the 6000. Seems these 6000 units are becoming scarce. I got to run through the settings of the 5000's to match the color and brightness of the 6000 (center display) and so real quick here's how these should essentially be set up:Mode: Movie*Backlight 10 for my 5000's and 16 for my 6000Contrast 100Brightness 50Sharpness 20Color 40Tint G50/R50Advanced:Color Space: AutoWhite Balance: 20,20,25,25,20,25 for the 5000's and 25,35,35,25,35,35 for the 6000.Gamma: 0Dynamic Contrast: OffBlack Tone: OffFlesh Tone: 0Motion Lighting: OffPicture Options:Color Tone: Warm2Size: Screen FitDigital Noise Filter: OffHDMI Black Level**: LowFilm Mode: OffAuto Motion Plus: OffLED Motion Plus: Off* Movie Mode, I don't know why anyone in their right mind would use any of the other modes, unless you want that ugly bluish tint associated with LCD displays. Movie Mode applies warmer, smoother and more natural looking contrast and tones, giving you a proper image.** HDMI Black Level should be set to Low. This drops the black to practically zero, so that black backgrounds on the screen won't be glowing blackish-grey. I assume the LEDs turn off to achieve this. I had an issue where the 6000 unit was greying out the option for me, so that it's blacks were not as black as the 5000's and the image didn't feel as deep as the other screens, not to mention when setting all three to a black background, the 6000 was a noticeable few shades lighter. I solved this by going into my graphics card pixel format (ATI Catalyst Control Center > My Digital Flat-Panels > Pixel Format) and choosing RGB 4:4:4 Full RGB. This made the black level option in the TV available and now all three displays match up perfectly.The auto-motion feature sounds like a nice must-have on paper, but I never use it. I could see the interpolation being nice for watching sports, but it makes everything else (TV shows, movies) look unnaturally smooth-- what they refer to in layman's terms as the 'soap opera effect'.I'm fairly confident in Samsung displays, seeing as how the 40" LCD TV I bought my parents is doing just fine, after some 5 years of regular use. Same with my 61" Samsung DLP TV in my living room. Been in use for years, not one issue. *knocks wood*

Reviews.Title: Simple and best
Reviews.Author: Vikas
Reviews.Content: Only drawback only 2 HDMI port... There is nothing to complain, smart TV I do not care as almost devices connected to TV are smart.

Reviews.Title: Poor interoperability but great picture
Reviews.Author: T. Kraft
Reviews.Content: It's a good TV but if you want to use a sound bar, look elsewhere!  With Samsung TVs, the TV remote will not control the sound bar volume unless you get a Smart TV that has the HDMI-ARC feature (AnyNet they call it).  For some reason, Samsung thinks that only people that buy smart tvs will want to use a sound bar with it so the only TVs with ARC are the Smart TVs.  If you connect the sound bar with digital audio, you've got good sound. But if you turn off the TV speakers (which you will want to do), then the tv remote no longer controls volume and you have to use the sound bar remote.  And the Samsung sound bar (450 model) does not recognize any of the device codes available in my Cable tv remote control.  so no luck there.  Only possible solution is to get a Harmony remote and program it for the cable + tv + audio which is stupid in my mind.  Samsung blew it.  Next time, I'll do more homework and will not consider a Samsung!

Reviews.Title: Needed a new one.
Reviews.Author: shar
Reviews.Content: Got a the new 40" for spare room and decided we need a new TV for the livingroom.  We like this one too but is not quite a great of a pic.

Reviews.Title: You just can't beat the deal...
Reviews.Author: G. Orlando
Reviews.Content: Considering the picture quality your getting, how can you beat it? The picture is so crisp it freaks my wife out. This TV is my best friend.

Reviews.Title: great deal for black friday
Reviews.Author: patrick
Reviews.Content: got a great deal on an awesome product, this with a blue ray player looks like your in whatever film you put on

Reviews.Title: No Wifi - No Problem
Reviews.Author: ReviewsbyRuhfuss
Reviews.Content: I spent much time researching different options for a TV. The first step was to determine the type of TV to go with, LED, LCD, or plasma. After doing the proper research I landed on an LED style with 120hz refresh rate. I have the 46" version of this TV. This review is not as indepth as many reviews on this TV, but as a lay person when it comes to TV buying, let me sum it up for you. If you are looking for a TV without any smart features, this TV will take care of your needs. The picture quality is crystal clear and because of the 120hz refresh rate when watching sports and fast action scenes you don't get any of that annoying blur. I use this TV primarily for gaming and watching sports and I couldn't be happier with the decision I made. I have an Xbox so any features you get with a smart TV are taken care of through the wifi of the Xbox. I ordered the TV through Amazon Warehouse Deals, the TV came repackaged, but you wouldn't have known it taking it out of the box. Saved quite a bit of cash and because of that I highly recommend Warehouse Deals to other users. All in all, fast refresh rate so the picture is clear without blur, perfect for gaming, and built with quality.

Reviews.Title: Great deal!
Reviews.Author: tdaigl4
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV from Amazon in 2012. I've waited about a year to post a review. Still works great. Picture is amazing.Sound is a good quality as well.Definitely a good buy.

Reviews.Title: Incredible colors and blacks
Reviews.Author: A "Contented Man"
