I'm already getting used to it and think I will eventually like it a lot, but I can understand that many people might be put off by it.  If you think you might be one of those people, then be careful, because as far as I can tell there is no way to adjust to a lower rate, like 60Hz.  I thought it would be permitted, but there's no mention of it in the manual and nothing in the menus.One complaint I do have is that it only has 2 HDMI ports.  This isn't a problem if all you have is a TV box and Blu Ray player, but if you want to connect things like a PC or console device in as well, you're going to have to play musical ports, which I've been doing with a laptop from time to time.  Not sure why they were skimpy on that.Overall I think it's an excellent TV.  It's a bit pricey, but if you've got the money it's hard to go wrong with this one.

Reviews.Title: The one thing you need to know...
Reviews.Author: Diogenes
Reviews.Content: Yes, nice picture and OK sound. But the one thing that you need to know about this TV, and about all Samsung TVs, is that they have an insane, inexplicable design flaw: you can't manually add channels or navigate to a channel unless the autoprogram decides it's there. In my case that means that even though a TV located 50' away receives channels 29-1, 26-1 etc, because the Samsung's "Auto Program" didn't pick them up, I can't input them into the remote or navigate them to them with the Channel keys. ("Add Channel" works off the autoprogram, so you can't add channels onscreen, either.)If you had told me, before I purchased this Samsung, that a TV manufacturer would purposely design a TV with no way to manually select a channel, I wouldn't have believed it.If you're one of the 75% that has cable or dish, this will be, I think, no problem for you (though there may be other  ridiculous Samsung design flaws that I haven't discovered). But if you're an over-the-air guy like me, you're out of luck if you purchase this item.And, yes, I called Samsung, and also did the online chat. "Patrick" at Samsung confirmed that you don't program a Samsung TV, a Samsung TV programs what you watch. And I found via Google hundreds of people online posting about this problem...unfortunately, too late to get another brand.My strong advice: look at another brand. Avoid all Samsung until this insane flaw is corrected. Learn from my expensive mistake.

Reviews.Title: TV REVIEW
Reviews.Author: JOHN P. DOLLY
Reviews.Content: The tv so far has been great. It would be given 5 stars based on performance except for the almost non existant instructions. Other than pluging it in and turning the set on they are useless. Thankfully another reviewer gave very good suggestions on settings that were perfect. Why Samsung is so cheap on providing detailed directions makes no sense. The lack of HDMI ports is also stupid but I knew this was a problem before I purchased the set and I didn't need more than 2. The picture is great. I've had this running for 3 weeks so far have not have had any picture problems.

Reviews.Title: Great TV but not perfect
Reviews.Author: Trainspotting
Reviews.Content: I bought the 46 inch version to replace another older Samsung 46 inch LCD hdtv.  The main reason I went for the LED was that the LCD tv gets awfully hot and actually would raise the temperature in the room several degrees when it was on for an extended period plus uses more energy.  This tv stays nice and lukewarm plus it's energy star certified so it uses minimal energy.  The only reason I am giving this tv 4 stars instead of 5 is due to the lack of inputs.  Im ok with the 2 hdmi inputs, but my older Samsung had 2 component and 2 composite and this one only has 1 component/composite input, so I had to buy an additional splitter plus cables to hook up some other a/v items where my older TV had inputs to spare.  Samsung dropped the ball on that respect, but the TV looks and sounds great.  So far I have owned 3 different Samsung flat panel tvs in the past few years and they are all great.  I personally vouch for the Samsung brand in hdtvs.

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased with this TV
Reviews.Author: 365CloudTech
Reviews.Content: Let me tell you, right out of the box on default settings most people will not like the way this TV looks. I actually turned off the "CMR" because it gave off the day-time soap opera type of look. I just wasn't into it.However make sure you play with your settings on this, it will take some time too. I believe it's "Auto Motion" that you can go into and customize. I set this to custom and move the top bar to 10, and bottom bar to 0 (Sorry I'm not near my tv to tell you the exact names!).Also if you plan on plugging in a computer to this, make sure you plug it into HDMI 1, then in the Source List change it to PC. It will make your TV change into a brighter, monitor style. Also lower your sharpness down to about 10 for the best "from PC" image.Cheers!

Reviews.Title: Homeowner
Reviews.Author: Kirk
Reviews.Content: Loved this TV as soon as we hooked it up. Using the HDMI inputs and the optics out to a JVC sound bar. Installed with a wall mount that worked quite well and as mentioned the TV is great. I am not a real TV geek so I am sure there are folks that will disagree but for the money I am very happy I went with this model.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Jonathan Rollins
Reviews.Content: I am still adjusting the settings as stated below in some other posts but I would buy this TV again.  Great picture and price.

Reviews.Title: POOR  SUPPORT FROM SAMSUNG WRONG LAN ADAPTER
Reviews.Author: davis123
Reviews.Content: BUYER BEWAREWhen I first purchased my new Led TV about 14 months ago I didn't yet have the internet installed ,about four months ago it was installed and I tried to get my Smart TV to be smart. Because I am out of town a lot, I would only have the weekends to watch TV, Every weekend I would spent time trying to stay connect to the internet, reading the manual, following all the trouble shooting recommendations, eventually I would get frustrated and give up. Because my laptop worked anywhere in the house, people at a local TV sales store said my tv should also be working . They offered to test the LAN adapter, so last weekend I brought it over only to find out Samsung supplied me with the wrong adapter which came with my TV, my TV was manufactured May 2011. Yesterday and today I spent lots of time talking to Samsung customer reps only to find out they will not correct the problem, because my TV is out of warranty. Basically in my opinion this is not a warranty problem; Samsung included a lan adapter for a 2009 which is NOT COMPATABLE with my TV which was made in May of 2011 and will not make good on it.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 46" LED HDTV
Reviews.Author: kbb0123
Reviews.Content: This online purchase was "Live Chat" assisted which was very helpful.  The TV arrived in fine condition; I was able to set it up without fuss.  The most frustrating thing I found was the lack of a digital jack for my Sennheiser wireless headphones...... Fortunately Comcast advised me to consult Radio Shack to obtain a digital OPTICAL CONVERTER AND CABLE which connects to the optical jack on the back of the TV.  Some $70+ dollars later, I was able to use my headphones.  To purchase digital optical headphones is exoribantly expensive.  Researching this problem on the internet yielded similar deficiencies with the Samsung TV's regardless of the price variances.  Overall I am satisfied with this purchase and the product.

Reviews.Title: Go For It!
Reviews.Author: Karen Springer
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv because I thought it would look good in a corner in my livingroom where I have a big hole in the wall and this really does the trick!  The excellent quality of the this tv was an added plus.  I was going to buy it at Walmart, but it didn't fit in my car.  So, I came over here to Amazon and found this great deal.  Plus, my brother, who has a Ph.D. in surfing from Pepperdine University said I saved money on gas since I didn't have to pay for shipping. Overall, I would say purchasing this tv was one of the best decisions I've made in a long time.  But, that's another story.  For those of you who complained that the remote was too small, all I gotta say is that it's a lot like a man.  It doesn't matter how small it is.  As long as you handle it properly, it will get the job done.  For those of you looking for a tv that will wash the dishes and vacuum the floor, this is not for you. For those of you looking for a great value for your dollar, and will take some time to turn it on and perhaps read the instructions before judging it, you will be pleasantly surprised.  Especially, if you're watchig the movie, "Magic Mike".  This is a great tv!

Reviews.Title: happy with purchse
Reviews.Author: Jrae
Reviews.Content: Great tv.  Picture so much better than our plasma we had that was about 6 years old. We do have surround sound and use it for better quality audio.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for me
Reviews.Author: Ryan L Ropers
Reviews.Content: I got exactly what I wanted with this model.  Pretty basic, but brillant display.  Very happy.  Don't use factory settings.  Use the THX set up.

Reviews.Title: Not Bad, but not as good as hoped (yet)
Reviews.Author: Wayne Peterkin
Reviews.Content: It was delivered very quickly and in good shape. The picture quality on the factory settings is awful. I have been tweaking settings for the past several days and it is much better although still not as good as expected. Replaced a Sony LCD (same size, similar specs) that started giving trouble after just 3 - 4 years. Won't buy another Sony, but I still don't have the Samsung's picture set as good as the Sony's was. For a similar price, I had a choice between this Samsung and a Vizio and I'm not yet sure I made the best choice. If I can find the right combination of settings, it could still turn out great, we'll see.

Reviews.Title: is it worth it?
Reviews.Author: zack_allensworth
Reviews.Content: This is a good tv, not quite sure it's worth the money yet though.However the picture quality is very good.

Reviews.Title: best buy TV
Reviews.Author: audios22
Reviews.Content: After lots of research, i settled on the Samsung. great value. I highly recommend this purchase to anyone looking for a TV

Reviews.Title: samsung un46eh6000
Reviews.Author: mje
Reviews.Content: Too many models to choose and compare from! Picture ok but maybe not quite as sharp as i saw on some similar samsung models...very easy to setup and change settings...overall seems like a good purchase

Reviews.Title: 46" Samsung LED HDTV
Reviews.Author: ROBERT GRAY
Reviews.Content: Like the TV very much.  Unit was shipped and received timely and safely.  Great way to order this item.  Quality is great.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN46EH6000 1080p 120Hz HDTV
Reviews.Author: dbarr92990
Reviews.Content: Item arrived early and was easy to assemble and install. Picture quality is excellent and is easy to operate. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: Perfection!
Reviews.Author: happyhusband
Reviews.Content: This 46" is now mounted above my fireplace with the wall mount and looks/works amazing. Arrived when promised and in perfect condition, My only issue was an older cable box I needed to upgrade for true HDMI connections, not the TV's fault.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 46" 1080p 120 hz led hdtv
Reviews.Author: Miriam T. Goodale "-Book Lover"
Reviews.Content: My husband loves this t.v.  This one is just for him.  He has high definition, out of this world picture.

Reviews.Title: Pleasantly Surprised!
Reviews.Author: TJF in UAE
Reviews.Content: My fiancé and I went back and forth over whether to spend the money on this product, the Samsung UN46EH6000 46-Inch.  We asked all the questions:Is it going to look too big in the apartment?Is it compatible with the other electronic devices?Is the "SMART" TV complicated to use?Will we use the SMART features?She was for, I was against.  I could not have been more wrong!  The TV fit perfectly into our 1 bedroom apartment.  All 46 inches of it did not come close to overwhelming the apartment, I was amazed!  The TV is incredibly stylish.  It has a nice tight frame so it is basically all picture.  Six cables, three for the DVD player, three for the cable box and we were all hooked up.  The ethernet cable was as simple as can be, just click it into the port on the back of the TV, and the other end to the Service Router and you are immediately connected for SMART TV service which was incredibly easy.  We were watching NETFLIX within minutes of unpacking.I'm big into energy conservation, and the LED construction is really nice.  I no longer feel guilty about leaving the power strip on when we leave the apartment for the weekend.  The other thing is moving it, the TV is sooooooo light and easy to move.  If you save the box and styrofoam you never have to worry about damaging it during a move.I can't say enough great things about this device.  This is one great TV!

Reviews.Title: Big TV...Great Picture!
Reviews.Author: TJ the DJ "Country music lover"
Reviews.Content: After doing some research on the overall popularity of the televisions on Amazon's website, I ordered this tv.  It did not disappoint.  This is my first LED TV and its picture is great.  At the present time, I cannot view any programs in HD, but the picture is still as clear as can be.  The sound is also good, but I may set up a theater sound system to make full use of the wide screen.  Overall, a great tv and at a great price!

Reviews.Title: Samsung LED HDTV 46"
Reviews.Author: Kate L
Reviews.Content: Our family is very pleased with the Samsung 46" LED HDTV Flat Screen TV.  It has a very clear picture and sound is great. I would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Warranties
Reviews.Author: William I. Hemphill
Reviews.Content: Be advised that the Warranty on Samsung items may of little value as every problem is denied. Refer to the class action law suit on Samsung LN series TV's power source failure due to bad capacitors and Samsungs refusal to accept claim forms as directed by the court. A phone number to inquire of any problem only produces a disconnected phone message.

Reviews.Title: Not reliable!
Reviews.Author: T. Silva "28CAMale"
Reviews.Content: Reading the specifications I thought this TV would be perfect for me. I just wanted a simple TV, without 3D or smart features. The price was right so I decided to give it a try.First, the image of this TV is not uniform. Try to plug a computer on it and put a white background and you are gonna understand what I'm saying... If you look at it in any angle you see that the backlight is not uniform, giving you the impression that there are a lot of stains in the white. Since I plugged a Google TV device on it, when I was browsing the web this was actually bothering me a lot. Other problem I found on this TV is that there was a kind of permanent "fingerprint" on the right corner of the TV... that you could see from any angle and with whatever image being displayed... That was very very bad and annoying feeling....So, I ordered another TV, exactly the same, believing that I was very unlucky, since this TV is one of the TVs that has the best review average on Amazon (almost 5 starts). For my surprise, the replacement I received was damaged and unusable... You couldn't even see the TV menu on the screen, because the image was all distorted.I'm returning both TVs... Such a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: Picture quality is ok, sound is bad...
Reviews.Author: Kimberley
Reviews.Content: After a long search for an avarage priced LED TV I came across the samsung. The picture quality is ok when you really have HD quality video's. If you will use this tv also to view analog channels or with an antenna attached do not buy this TV. The picture quality becomes very poor. While on a panasonic tv the picture quality is ok to good with the same antenna input.Next to that the sound of this TV is not so great. You will definitely need a soundbar if you want to enjoy movies or  any music video's. My tv also makes a weird sound at one of the speakers when the bass is too deep. While the TV is only a few months old.

Reviews.Title: Worth for the price
Reviews.Author: Rajesh ch
Reviews.Content: After so much research we ended up buying this - got good price & features we r looking for.After the TV got delivered, we didn't regret any moment till now.Fun to have this TV.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic!
Reviews.Author: M. Walker
Reviews.Content: Very clear picture and sound.  I purchased this tv to replace a 27" LCD HD tv in the bedroom - wish I'd done it a lot sooner!  This was a lot of money for me to spend on a tv, but it's worth every penny.  It's better than the 42" LCD HD tv in the livingroom connected to high definition through Dish Network.

Reviews.Title: VERY PLEASED FROM OHIO
Reviews.Author: SLOWPOKE
Reviews.Content: THE SAMSUNG UN46EH6000 46 IN TV SURE DOES A EXCELLENT JOB FOR US,ALL WE WANTED WAS A GOOD PICTURE AND A QUALITY SOUND AND WE HAVE IT IN THIS TV. THERE ARE AMPLE USB PORTS FOR US,THE PICTURE IS GREAT AND WOULD RECOMMEND THE UN46EH6000 FOR ANYONE JUST WANTING A GOOD TV!!

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Daniel P. Evans
Reviews.Content: This TV has the best picture that I have ever seen. It makes every show look live. A great TV.

Reviews.Title: Not a good deal as I thought !
Reviews.Author: Jay
Reviews.Content: I bought it for around $650.00. But was found it as not a good deal. I would have got a better one with similar price.  But as such, the item works fine. No complaint so far ( only two weeks only) observed.

Reviews.Title: Just like an HD TV should be
Reviews.Author: scribo
Reviews.Content: No problems, no complaints, a moment of weirdness with the "soap opera effect," but that was clarified and rectified easily once I researched it.

Reviews.Title: Mother Board Failure - Lots of issues
Reviews.Author: BLSeattle
Reviews.Content: Be wary of purchasing Samsung's television products. I have a 3-year old version of this model and have replaced the capacitor and the mother board. I have also talked with others that have experienced similar issues. It's a real shame, because the quality of the picture is outstanding and these units are among the top-rated in terms of performance. Sadly, expect to pay at least $238.50 in repairs within 3 years.

Reviews.Title: Don't be fooled this is not 240hz
Reviews.Author: jbarn
Reviews.Content: The motion rating on these new HDTV's can be misleading so the customer must be informed when purchasing.  This is not a 240hz TV.  It has a 'Clear Motion Rate' of 240 and the TV is rated at 120hz refresh rate.  The CMR rating means that the screen refreshes at 120 frames per second and the LED backlight is blinking at 120 times per second which helps with motion blur.  Get your facts straight Amazon!

Reviews.Title: LED is the stuff
Reviews.Author: B. Upchurch "B. Upchurch"
Reviews.Content: My first LED TV after 2 Samsungs (Plasma and LCD) from Amazon developed lines down the side of the image and were junked... both in about 18 months and of course after expiration of the 12 month warranty. This LED picture is so vibrant and alive it is like a new experience for the whole family! I can never go back to plasma or LCD. I will be even happer if this one lasts a full 2 years!

Reviews.Title: WOW! Excellent Everything!
Reviews.Author: Triplet Mommy
Reviews.Content: I must admit this is my first HD TV, but after carefully I chose this one. It was easy to setup, a breeze to use. Watching sports is amazing! Sound is great, completely enjoying this item!

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Leyland Cypress
Reviews.Content: This TV replaces the Samsung UN46D6000 which was stolen in a home break-in. I can't comment on the features of the TV or the on-screen set-up procedure or even the quality of the picture because mine arrived DOA. But that's not why I'm rating it one star. This TV is supposed to be a direct replacement for the D6000, which was last year's model, so I would naturally assume to realize some slight improvements here and there in fit, finish and performance. I certainly wouldn't expect a wholesale dimunition in overall quality compared to the prior model, but beyond setting it on its stand and plugging it in, these two TVs don't compare equally at all in the physical aspects.Here's what I noticed, in no particular order, and I've only been fooling with it for an hour or so.First, the printed documentation in the box amounts to a few sheets of safety warnings, assemble-the-base instructions, etc. and then an oragami-folded Quick Start Guide and also a User's Manual. Listen, do yourself a favor and download these same documents from Samsung's web site and file or throw the paper away. They are difficult to read and don't contain exactly the same information as the PDFs, which are more complete and helpful.Next, the remote has the same layout as the D6000 but it's at least a third smaller, and the original wasn't large by any means.Next, there's no power light on the front bezel. Now a lot of people will say why do I need a power light on a device that's always on anyway. Well, on the D6000 it would blink when powered up to full operational mode (out of standby) and that was useful because you would know that the remote's signal hit its target. On this TV the power light is on the underside of the front bezel. You can only see its reflection, and that's only if it's mounted on a shiny surface in a dark room.Next, the stand is short and squat. You won't notice unless your previous stand positioned the TV in a certain space relative to that space's top-bottom and side-to-side boundaries like mine did.Other people have mentioned that the stand seems to tilt the TV ever so slightly forward. At first I didn't notice but then I put a carpenter's level on it. Yup, about five degrees, and it's not because I mis-assembled the base. You won't notice unless you look at it edgewise, but still, this is a high-end piece of electronic equipment. Is there some reason for this?The HDMI ports (all 2 of them) and the USB port are located on the right side, behind the bezel in a little recess. This might be handy for non-wall mounts. Why? If you don't have an AV receiver or a HDMI switch and you have more than 2 HDMI devices, you can make substitutions somewhat easier from the side than the back. For the same reason, if you have content on USB flash drives.Now it gets serious. My D6000 stand was rock solid. It was big, heavy and stable. The TV sat on it rock steady. If you nudged the TV's bezel forward or back, no movement at all. If you needed to rotate the TV on its base, you had to do it with purpose. This TV, the base is significantly less substantial. Worse, the TV rocks noticeably if disturbed, like a 50-pound child jumping from a chair to the floor. Worst of all, the base does not rotate -- meaning if you want to swing the TV in an arc to provide better viewing from a different angle, you've got to move the entire assembly -- base and TV.The TV is thicker front to back. My opening can accomodate it; yours might not.I paid a little less for this TV but I assumed that to be due to the vagaries of the market. I did not expect to get less. I would have gladly paid the same as a year ago had I been assured of the same quality. Then again, the half-gallon container of ice cream no longer exists; it's some few ounces short but the price is the same. The same is true for a lot of products -- they mess with the value equation, hoping we won't notice. I hate that.Not Amazon though. I freakin' LOVE Amazon. I haven't even called them yet to return this TV but I know when I do I won't get any gruff about the return or the re-order. I'm a Prime member, an Audible member, and if I buy online, I look at Amazon first. It it's cheaper somewhere else then it's got to be substanstially so to offset the peace of mind in dealing with Amazon. You guys are the best!

Reviews.Title: Poor quality and poor customer care
Reviews.Author: S & B Two Wheels
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV in April 2011 and it has failed due to a defective power supply. I contacted Samsung for repair assistance and used their recommended repair service. I paid over $400.00 to have this TV repaired. Samsung refused to refund any of the repair cost. I would recommend that you NOT purchase a product from Samsung. A product that fails in less than 18 months and the company will not stand behind it does not deserve customer loyalty. Samsung has lost a customer for life.

Reviews.Title: Not what I wanted
Reviews.Author: Jerry Donatto
Reviews.Content: 1.Sound is very bad,rumbling noise when I am watching a ball game2.No picture & picture3.TV Set does not stand up straight when sitting on a stand4. I have two other Samsung TV Sets and they have all what I want

Reviews.Title: Good TV until it breaks
Reviews.Author: Sean
Reviews.Content: Had two HDMI ports decide to stop working.  I recently took a chance switching to Samsung TVs and learned the hard way about their inferior build quality.Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Same Samsung reliability issues still unresolved after two years.
Reviews.Author: ds
Reviews.Content: I bought my Samsung nearly two years ago and while I have been very happy with the quality of the display (the two stars would have been five), I am ready to replace it.  I cannot speak for everyone, but my Samsung has been anything but reliable.  It seems to have many of the same problem other buyers of Samsung TVs have experienced as I read other reviewers of Samsung TVs.  My problems are as follows:  1.  Turns off and on by itself.  2.  Completely switches off and will not come back on.  When this happens I have to disconnect power  from the TV between 5 to 30 minutes to get it to work again.  3.  Aspect ratio randomly changes.  4.  Input selection randomly changes.While reviewing possible replacements, I decided to read the reviews of current Samsung TVs and I learned that some of my problems with my current two year old set still has not been resolved by Samsung.  This is obviously unacceptable and I will purchase another brand.This is too bad since Samsung makes a wonderful TV when it works.  If you are considering purchasing a Samsung, I encourage you to read the reviews of others who have reported similar reliability problems that I have experienced.  What I find most telling is that after two years, Samsung has not resolved these basic reliability issues.

Reviews.Title: VERY GOOD BUT......
Reviews.Author: DENVER BILL
Reviews.Content: THE PICTURE IS VERY CRISP WITHOUT DISTORTION.  NO ADDED POUNDS ON THE CHARACTERS OR SQUEEZED TO LOOK LIKE THEY WERE RUN OVER BY MAC TRUCK.  COLOR IS EXCELLENT AND CONTRAST IS VERY GOOD.  THE SOUND LEVEL HAS TO BE ADJUSTED BY CONTINUOUSLY PULSE PUSHING THE VOLUME BUTTON. IT IS MINOR, BUTANOYING WHEN YOU'RE TRYING NOT TO WAKE THE HOUSE UP EARLY IN THE MORNING.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT PURCHASE
Reviews.Author: Laurie
Reviews.Content: I bought this because it was Samsung.  This tv is the worst.  The glass shatters if you touch it.  Once it is in place, you cannot even think about moving it, dusting it, nothing.  It will break.  The picture is great otherwise.  The lesser expensive brands stand up much better with little difference in picture quality.

Reviews.Title: NEVER BUY SAMSUNG!!!!
Reviews.Author: LLN
Reviews.Content: I bought a Samsung tv in 2008 for over $3,000 which has since become a paper weight because Samsung REFUSES to support it product. It has taken a class action law suit to receive any customer service from this company and the lawsuit was so narrow that it missed an additional issue that thousands of the affected tv's were beset with: faulty mainboards. This company is terrible and should be shut out of the US market for selling junk. DO NOT BUY THEIR PRODUCTS!!

Reviews.Title: Samsung smart TV
Reviews.Author: SLWADA "sanwa"
Reviews.Content: I like Samsung TVs for their high quality, picture is great, but I paid more for this TV for the Smart option just to find out that I can't use with Amazon VOD, because Samsung does not have the app. I am very disappointed because now I need to buy a devise to be able to get Amazon service. I could buy a cheaper TV and spend on the devise and be in the same place. Samsung needs to improve that part and make it accessible to all the services available in the market otherwise it will lose their market share.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy any Samsung TV
Reviews.Author: Jay A. Henderson
Reviews.Content: I purchased a Samsung 52 inch TV in Jan 2010 and the backlights are shot.  Samsung will not cover any repair that is out of warranty.  This is a 1200 dollar repair for a 2000 dollar TV. DO NOT BUY

Reviews.Title: my life as a samsung electronics owner
Reviews.Author: LARRY JACKSON
Reviews.Content: PROexcellent picture when workingexcellent item for buying extended & pricey warrantiesCONno market as a resale item ( the buyers available are most likely owners of failed samsung electronics )2007As an early adapter I must admit the samsung experience has been a drive through hell. (all items bought within 1 yr.)Failed Samsung LNT4053H 40-Inch LCD HDTV  1 month passed 1 year warranty (- $999.99 )Failed blu-ray player because firmware update disabled player (-$499.99 )24" SYNCMASTER 2493 (1920 x 1200) ( $399.99 + $70.+ return shipping ) failed, self-return shipping, then charged $70 for replacement new monitor.This review is about samsung.  As far as the 2012 series I have been afraid to buy therefor I have no ownership words.

ProductInfo.Name: Samsung UN46EH6000 46-Inch 1080p 120Hz LED HDTV (Black) (2012 Model)
